intro: Selinum kochii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved garlic chives, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. It is often cultivated for its edible leaves, which have a mild garlic flavor. Selinum kochii thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
